items.name: Component_UIBehavior
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Component_StyleHandler
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Component_UIBehavior extends gs.Component
    ###*
    * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used
    * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc.
    * 
    * @method onDataBundleRestore.
    * @param Object data - The data-bundle
    * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context.
    ###
    onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) ->
        @setupEventHandlers()
        
    ###*
    * @module ui
    * @class Component_UIBehavior
    * @extends gs.Component
    * @memberof ui
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: () ->
        @breakChainAt = null
        @containsPointer = no
        @isAnimating = no
        @viewData_ = [yes, no, no, yes, no]
        @nextKeyObjectId = ""
        @nextKeyObject_ = null
        @prevKeyObject_ = null
        
    @accessors "nextKeyObject", 
        set: (v) ->
            @nextKeyObject_ = v
            if v
                v.ui.prevKeyObject_ = @object
        get: -> @nextKeyObject_
        
    @accessors "prevKeyObject", 
        set: (v) ->
            @prevKeyObject_ = v
            if v
                v.ui.nextKeyObject_ = @object
        get: -> @prevKeyObject_
                
    @accessors "selected", 
        set: (v) -> 
            if v != @viewData_[2]
                @viewData_[2] = v
                @updateStyle()
                
        get: -> @viewData_[2]
        
    @accessors "hover", 
        set: (v) -> 
            if v != @viewData_[1]
                @viewData_[1] = v
                @updateStyle()
                
        get: -> @viewData_[1]
        
    @accessors "enabled",
        set: (v) -> 
            if v != @viewData_[3]
                @viewData_[3] = v
                @updateStyle()
                
        get: -> @viewData_[3]
        
    @accessors "focused",
        set: (v) ->
            if v != @viewData_[4]
                @viewData_[4] = v
                @updateStyle()
        get: -> @viewData_[4]
        
    @accessors "viewData",
        set: (v) ->
            if v != @viewData_
                @viewData_ = v
                @updateStyle()
        get: -> @viewData_
    
    
    ###*
    * Prepares the UI-Object for display. This method should be called
    * before a new created UI-Object will be displayed to position all
    * sub-elements correctly.
    *
    * @method prepare
    ###
    prepare: ->
        scene = SceneManager.scene
        scene.preparing = yes
        @object.update() # First Update: Bring all sub-elements in correct size
        @object.update() # Second Update: Correct layout
        scene.preparing = no
        @object.events.emit("uiPrepareFinish")
     
     
    ###*
    * Executes an animation defined for the specified event. Each UI-Object
    * can have animations for certain events defined in JSON.
    *
    * @param {string} event - The event to execute the animation for such as "onTerminate" or "onInitialize". If
    * no animation has been defined for the specified event, nothing will happen and the callback will be called 
    * immediately.
    * @param {Function} callback - An optional callback function called when the animation ends.
    * @method executeAnimation
    ###
    executeAnimation: (event, callback) ->
        @isAnimating = yes
        @disappearCounter = @object.subObjects.length + 1
        @disappearCallback = callback
        
        for object in @object.subObjects
            if object.ui
                object.ui.executeAnimation(event, (sender) =>
                    @disappearCounter--
                    
                    if @disappearCounter == 0
                        @isAnimating = no
                        @disappearCallback?(@object)
                )
            else
                @disappearCounter--
         
        animation = @object.animations?.first (a) -> a.events.indexOf(event) != -1
        
        if animation
            @object.animationExecutor.execute(animation, (sender) =>
                @disappearCounter--
                if @disappearCounter == 0
                    @isAnimating = no
                    @disappearCallback?(@object) 
            )
        else
            @disappearCounter--
            if @disappearCounter == 0
                @isAnimating = no
                @disappearCallback?(@object) 
    
    ###*
    * Executes the animation defined for the "onInitialize" event. Each UI-Object
    * can have animations for certain events defined in JSON.
    *
    * @param {Function} callback - An optional callback function called when the animation ends.
    * @method appear
    ###        
    appear: (callback) -> 
        gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("uiAnimationStart")
        cb = (sender) => 
            gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("uiAnimationFinish")
            callback?(sender)
        @executeAnimation("onInitialize", cb)
        
    ###*
    * Executes the animation defined for the "onTerminate" event. Each UI-Object
    * can have animations for certain events defined in JSON.
    *
    * @param {Function} callback - An optional callback function called when the animation ends.
    * @method disappear
    ###    
    disappear: (callback) -> 
        gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("uiAnimationStart")
        cb = (sender) => 
            gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("uiAnimationFinish")
            callback?(sender)
        @executeAnimation("onTerminate", cb)
        
    ###*
    * Disposes the component.
    *
    * @method dispose
    ###
    dispose: ->
        super
        
        gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner "mouseUp", @object
        gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("objectGotFocus", @object)
        gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("keyUp", @object)
        gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseDown", @object)
        gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseMoved", @object)
     
    ###*
    * Adds event-handlers for mouse/touch events
    *
    * @method setupEventHandlers
    ### 
    setupEventHandlers: ->
        if @object.focusable
            gs.GlobalEventManager.on "objectGotFocus", ((e) =>
                if e.sender != @object
                    @blur()
            ),
            null, @object

            gs.GlobalEventManager.on "keyUp", ((e) =>
                return if !@object.canReceiveInput()
                if @focused
                    if @nextKeyObject and (Input.release(Input.KEY_DOWN) or Input.release(Input.KEY_RIGHT))
                        @nextKeyObject.ui.focus()
                        e.breakChain = yes
                    else if @prevKeyObject and (Input.release(Input.KEY_UP) or Input.release(Input.KEY_LEFT))
                        @prevKeyObject.ui.focus()
                        e.breakChain = yes
            ),
            null, @object
            
        if @object.styles.first ((s) -> s.selector == 1)
            gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseMoved", ((e) =>
                    return if !@object.canReceiveInput()
                    return if !@enabled
                    contains = Rect.contains(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, 
                             @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height,
                             Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y)
                
                    if @containsPointer != contains or (@hover and !contains)
                        @containsPointer = contains
                        @object.needsUpdate = yes
                        @hover = contains
                        
                        @updateParentStyle()
                        @updateChildrenStyle()
    
                    return null                       
                ),
                null, @object
            
        if @object.focusable or @object.styles.first ((s) -> s.selector == 2 || s.selector == 4)
            gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseDown", ((e) =>
                    return if !@object.canReceiveInput()
                    return if !@enabled or Input.Mouse.buttons[Input.Mouse.LEFT] != 1
                    contains = Rect.contains(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, 
                             @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height,
                             Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y)
                    
                    if contains
                        @object.needsUpdate = yes
                        
                        @focus()
                        
                        if @object.selectable
                            if @object.group
                                @selected = yes
                                group = gs.ObjectManager.current.objectsByGroup(@object.group)
                                for object in group
                                    if object != @object
                                        object.ui.selected = no
                            else
                                @selected = !@selected
                        else
                            @updateStyle()
                            
                        @updateParentStyle()
                                        
                    return null                        
                ),
                null, @object, 0
                
    ###*
    * Initializes the binding-handler.
    * 
    * @method setup
    ###
    setup: ->
        @setupEventHandlers()
    
    ###*
    * Gives the input focus to this UI object. If the UI object is not focusable, nothing will happen.
    * 
    * @method focus
    ###               
    focus: ->
        if @object.focusable and !@focused
            @focused = yes
            @updateChildrenStyle()
            
            gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("objectGotFocus", @object)
    
    ###*
    * Removes the input focus from this UI object. If the UI object is not focusable, nothing will happen.
    * 
    * @method blur
    ###
    blur: ->
        if @object.focusable and @focused
            @focused = no
            @updateChildrenStyle()
            gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("objectLostFocus", @object)
            
    updateParentStyle: ->
        parent = @object.parent
        while parent
            parent.ui?.updateStyle()
            parent = parent.parent
        return null
    
    updateChildrenStyle: () ->
        if @object.controls
            for control in @object.controls
                if control and control.ui
                    control.ui.updateStyle()
                    control.ui.updateChildrenStyle()
        return null
                    
    updateStyle: ->
        if @object.styles
            for style in @object.styles
                if !@viewData_[style.selector]
                    style.revert(@object)
                                
            for style in @object.styles
                if style.target == -1
                    if @viewData_[style.selector]
                        style.apply(@object)
                else
                    objects = @object.parentsByStyle[style.target]
                    if objects
                        object = objects[0]
                        if object and object.ui.viewData_[style.selector]
                            style.apply(@object)
                            
            if @object.font
                @object.behavior.refresh?() # FIXME: Creates a dependency on Text-Behavior
                
        return null
        
    ###*
    * Updates the binding-handler.
    * 
    * @method update
    ###   
    update: ->
        if @nextKeyObjectId and !@nextKeyObject
            @nextKeyObject = gs.ObjectManager.current.objectById(@nextKeyObjectId)
        
     
ui.Component_UIBehavior = Component_UIBehavior
